div:
Notes
This table presents a summary of the constraints applicable to TestScript.setup.operation, TestScript.test.operation, and TestScript.teardown.operation elements. The operation elements should be configured consistently with the FHIR RESTful API summary.
Operations Table
operation.type operation.source operation.target operation.destination operation.parameter(s) operation.responseId
read N/A
Optional fixture1 to be read from the server, if specified, will substitute the "type" and "id" in the path: /[type]/[id]
Optional2
type: the resource "type" for the path: /[type]. Only used when an operation.target is not supplied, otherwise it is ignored.
Optional3
vread N/A
fixture1 to be read from the server, will substitute the "type" and "id" in the path: /[type]/[id]/_history/[vid]
Optional2
vid the version id ("vid") for the path: /[type]/[id]/_history/[vid]. Optional.
Optional3
update
fixture1 to be used as the updated resource
fixture1 to be updated on the server, will substitute the "type" and "id" in the path: /[type]/[id]
Optional2 N/A Optional3
delete N/A
fixture1 to be deleted from the server, will substitute the "type" and "id" in the path: /[type]/[id]
Optional2 N/A N/A
history N/A
Optional fixture1 to be read from the server, if specified, will substitute the "type" and "id" in the path: /[type]/[id]/_history
Optional2
type: the resource "type" for the path: /[type]/_history. Ignored if an operation.target is supplied.
If an operation.target or operation.parameter is not supplied, the path will result in "/_history"
Optional3
create
fixture1 to be used for the created resource, will substitute the "type" in the path: /[type]
N/A Optional2 N/A Optional3
search
Optional fixture1 type to be searched on the server, if specified, will substitute the "type" in the path: /[type]/_search?[params]
N/A Optional2
params: Optional search query "params" for the path: /[type]/_search?[params]
Optional3
transaction
fixture1 to use for the transaction, should be a Bundle.
N/A Optional2 N/A Optional3
conformance N/A assigns conformance document to the fixture id Optional2 N/A Optional3
tags N/A
Optional fixture1 to get tags for from the server, if specified, will substitute the "type" and "id" in the path: /[type]/[id]/_tags
Optional2
All parameters in the query string are optional.
vid: The version id ("vid") in the path: /[type]/[id]/_history/[vid]/_tags. If the operation.target was not specified, this argument is ignored.
delete: If "true" is specified, the resulting path will be constructed: /[type]/[id]/_tags/_delete. Defaults to "false" if missing, empty, or null. If the operation.target was not specified, this argument is ignored.
If "vid" and "delete" and operation.target are all specified, the resulting path will be constructed: /[type]/[id]/_history/[vid]/_tags/_delete
If an operation.target and operation.parameter are not supplied, the path will result in "/_tags"
Optional3
mailbox Not currently supported.
document Not currently supported.
assertion N/A N/A N/A
assertion: specifies the assertion function that is being made about the last non-assertion operation that was executed (operation.type != "assertion")
Additional parameters depend on the assertion function being called. A list of the various assertion function signatures are detailed below in the Assertions table.
N/A
assertion_false N/A N/A N/A
assertion: specifies the false assertion that is being made about the last non-assertion operation that was executed (operation.type != "assertion")
Additional parameters depend on the false assertion function being called. A list of the various assertion function signatures are detailed below in the Assertions table.
N/A
assertion_warning N/A N/A N/A
assertion: specifies the warning assertion function that is being made about the last non-assertion operation that was executed (operation.type != "assertion")
Additional parameters depend on the warning assertion function being called. A list of the various assertion function signatures are detailed below in the Assertions table.
N/A
Fixture: specified by TestScript.fixture.id and not the resource ID on the FHIR server.
Destination: If the TestScript is testing more than one FHIR server simultaneously, the destination identifies which server the operation applies to using zero-based indexing.
ResponseId: If a responseId is supplied, and the server responds with a Resource, then the resulting Resource is mapped to the fixture ID (which may be entirely new and previously undeclared) designated by "responseId."
Assertions
Assertion Function Assertion Parameters Assertion Description
equals
expected: value1 or xpath expression2
actual: value1 or xpath expression2
Asserts that "expected" is equal to "actual". Missing parameters default to null.
fixture_equals
fixture_id: the ID of a fixture
fixture_xpath: xpath expression2 into fixture specified by 'fixture_id'
actual: value1 or xpath expression2
Asserts that a node specified by 'fixture_xpath' within a Resource specified by 'fixture_id' has a value specified by 'actual'
fixture_compare
expected_fixture_id: the ID of a fixture
expected_fixture_xpath: xpath expression2 into fixture specified by 'expected_fixture_id'
actual_fixture_id: the ID of a fixture
actual_fixture_xpath: xpath expression2 into fixture specified by 'actual_fixture_id'
Asserts that a node specified by 'expected_fixture_xpath' within a Resource specified by 'expected_fixture_id' has a value specified by 'actual_fixture_xpath' within a Resource specified by 'actual_fixture_xpath'
minimum
fixture_id: the ID of a fixture
Asserts that the response contains at a minimum the fixture specified by 'fixture_id'.
validate
profile_fixture_id: the ID of a Profile fixture
Asserts that the response is valid according to the Profile specified by 'profile_fixture_id'.
response_code code: numeric HTTP response code Asserts that the response code equals "code".
response_okay N/A Asserts that the response code is in the set (200, 201).
response_gone N/A Asserts that the response code is 410.
response_not_found N/A Asserts that the response code is 404.
response_bad N/A Asserts that the response code is 400.
navigation_links Bundle Asserts that the Bundle contains first, last, and next links.
resource_type resourceType: string Asserts that the response contained a FHIR Resource of the given "resourceType".
valid_content_type N/A
Asserts that the response contains a "content-type" is either "application/xml+fhir" or "application/json+fhir" and that "charset" is specified as "UTF-8"
valid_content_location N/A Asserts that the response contains a valid "content-location" header.
valid_last_modified N/A Asserts that the response contains a valid "last-modified" header.
value is the string-representation of a number, string, or boolean.
xpath expressions are evaluated against the response body before the assertion is evaluated. xpath expression should return a value. If the expression returns a set of nodes, the assertion fails. xpath expressions are evaluated as-is if the server response or fixture representation is XML. If the server response or fixture representation is JSON, the xpath expression is first converted into a JsonPath expression, and then evaluated.
